intro: Vouapa elliptica, commonly known as the Madagascar velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Vouapa elliptica is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
